quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Eyes and Expressions
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, males, brain. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which one of these statements about facial microexpressions is not true?

options.text: Microexpressions can be controlled with certain types of chemicals.
Microexpressions contain much more information than common expressions.
Microexpressions can be easily read by any person.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Microexpressions can be easily read by any person.

questions.question: What emotional state does the gesture of narrowed eyes convey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Threat, distrust

questions.question: How many teeth does an average human have?
In which of these countries is showing negative facial expressions considered impolite and is therefore avoided?  Negative expressions are instead usually masked with smile or laughter.
In medicine, which of these brain disorders does the term prosopagnosia refer to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Inability to recognize faces

questions.question: The eyes of a baby weigh about 1/400 of its entire body mass. How much do the eyes of an adult weigh?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1/4000 of the body mass

questions.question: What British naturalist published the first major scientific study on facial communication in 1872?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Darwin

questions.question: The growth hormone is released from this gland.
How would you write 236,598 out in words?

options.text: Two million, thirty-six thousand, five hundred ninety-eight
Two hundred, thirty-six thousand, five hundred ninety-eight
Three hundred, thirty-six thousand, six hundred ninety-eight
Two hundred, three thousand, five hundred ninety-seven

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two hundred, thirty-six thousand, five hundred ninety-eight

questions.question: How long are the intestines of an average adult? (large and small)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: approx 8-9 meters (26-29.5 feet)

questions.question: Experiments prove that men are usually better at decoding facial expressions than women.
Kismet, a complicated technological achievement, is a very important step in the understanding of human facial expressions and their role in socialising. What is actually Kismet?

options.text: A technique for enhancing the ability of the face to conduct emotions
A set of tiny devices implanted under the skin, which detect microexpressions
An advanced computer system, designed to analyze microexpressions

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A sociable humanoid robot

questions.question: What can microexpressions, a type of tiny fleeting facial expressions, help you understand about the person you are talking with?

options.text: Their real attitude towards the topic
Whether they are telling the truth or not

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: An adult salivates this much per day, on average.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 liter (1/4 gallons)

questions.question: The eyes of males are bigger than those of females.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Death and Moon
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, emotions, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The term rigor mortis means this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stiffness of death

questions.question: Laughter is one of the first expressions of emotions babies learn to convey.  At about what age do babies start to laugh?
A death erection is a post-mortem erection which occurs when a male individual dies vertically or face-down.  What causes this condition?

options.text: Gravity causes the genitalia to fill up with blood

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gravity causes the genitalia to fill up with blood

questions.question: Which part of the body is decomposed last, but before the bones?
A large number of flies can appear around a dead body within the first 24 hours of death.  This is mainly because the flies lay eggs on the body, this multiplying their numbers.
The face of the person becomes difficult to recognize 24 hours after death.
The side of the Moon that we see is this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The same every night

questions.question: Because of the substance present in these structures of the human body, they can be preserved for centuries avoiding decomposition.
Which of the following happens three days after the moment of death?

options.text: The body starts to emit smell
The nails are so loose that they can be pulled off

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The body starts to swell

questions.question: In average conditions, approximately how many hours does it take for the dead bodys temperature to equalize with the surrounding environment?
The distance between the Moon and the Earth is approximately this much.
The Moon is changing its position it relation to the Earth. In what way?

options.text: Moving along the Earths Y axis
Moving along the Earths X axis

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moving away

questions.question: Due to this, there is almost no atmosphere on the Moon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Weak gravity

questions.question: This organ contains many bacteria, which begin to digest surrounding organs immediately after death.
The skin goes purple and waxy about one hour from time of death.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Study and Subject
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, lithosphere, frog. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This astral body, known as Earths only natural satellite, is the subject of study selenology.
These animals are the subject of study of coleopterology, which is a subfield of entomology.
A large exposition at the Royal Observatory, Greenwich is devoted to horology, a science that studies what?
Moons shape is not quite round. What does it resemble?
This species, considered to have colonized almost every landmass on Earth, is studied by myrmecology.
What is the subject of study of thanatology, personified in Greek mythology by Thanatos?
When was the Moon formed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: About 4.5 billion years ago

questions.question: The Moons diameter is approximately this long.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2,154 miles (3,476 km)

questions.question: A compass cannot be used on the Moon.  What factor is responsible for this?

options.text: Lack of gravity on the Moon

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lack of a magnetic field

questions.question: Which factor ensures that many of the craters on the Moons surface remain well preserved in comparison to those on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The lack of atmosphere

questions.question: A King Cobra and a frog would be subjects of study of what science?
This country, known for the worlds longest continuously used written language system, is the subject of study of sinology.
What national symbols are subject of study of vexillology?
This material on the surface of a lithosphere is the subject of study of pedology.
The Moon is taken into consideration when calculating the day of this religious celebration.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Term and Sinkholes
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, troops, refers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Nicotine can be found in tomatoes, potatoes, green peppers, coca plants and tobacco.
These biological poisons damage bio systems on contact. The injuries they cause resemble burns.
What term is used to designate a hurricanes calm, low-pressure center around which winds of high velocity spin?
What term do scientists use to denote the gradual warming of the planet due to absorption of infrared radiation by the atmosphere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greenhouse effect

questions.question: There are many different theories of how the Milky Way galaxy was born.
Sinkholes, natural depressions in the surface topography, may vary largely in size.
This contractile tissue of the body is the subject of study of myology.
What term refers to electric power produced by running or falling water?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hydroelectric power

questions.question: Will two tectonic plates sliding away from each other result in an earthquake?
Troops who are likely to be attacked with chemical weapons often carry auto-injectors with this substance.
A swallow hole is an unnatural depression in earths surface formed by the collapse of a large building.
Poisoning by this substance is often referred to as painters colic.
Strychnine poisoning produces some of the most terrifying and painful symptoms imaginable.
The geological area called The Ring of Fire is located along the borders of the Pacific Ocean.
Arsenic poisoning mainly disrupts this system.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Digestive system

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Doctor and Following
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, snakes, intact. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: If the doctor writes, CNs 2-12 intact, which of the following would be true?

options.text: The cervical nerves are all functioning normally.
The patient is able to close and open the eyes.
All of the lymph nodes in the cervical chain are normal.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The patient is able to close and open the eyes.

questions.question: This science studies signs, both individually and grouped in sign systems.
If you were taking a course in entomology, what would you be studying?
Etymologists study the history of languages and how the forms and meanings of different words changed.
In medical parlance, what is an AKA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The removal of a limb

questions.question: In medical jargon, what are PMH, PSH, SH and FH?

options.text: Past medical history, Past surgical history, Social history and Family history
Post-medical healing, Post-surgical healing, Surgical healing and Functional healing
Posterior middle hyoid, Posterior superior hyoid, Superficial hyoid and Foramen hyoidium
Patient mental hospital, Patient surgical hospital, Social hospital, and Female hospital

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Past medical history, Past surgical history, Social history and Family history

questions.question: At a party, a doctor asked a nurse: Are you an RN or an LPN?  The nurse replied: Im an RN. I got my BSN at Georgetown. Are you an MD or a DO?  The doctor replied: Im a DO. Which of the following statements can be concluded from this conversation?

options.text: The doctor is going to get lucky tonight.
The doctor is not really a doctor at all.
The doctor was trained in osteopathic manipulation.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The doctor was trained in osteopathic manipulation.

questions.question: What do abbreviations Rx, Tx, Hx and Sx mean?

options.text: Pharmacy, Treatment Room, Hospital and Sanitorium

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prescription, Treatment, History and Symptom

questions.question: If the doctor orders an EKG, what part of the body is going to be examined?
In medical jargon, FH: CAD (M), DM (F) implies what?

options.text: The patients mother died of an aneurysm, and the patients father died of a myocardial infarction.
The patients mother had a stroke, and the patients father had diabetes mellitus.
The patients mother had heart disease and the patients father had diabetes.
The patients mother was an engineer and the patients father was a computer programmer.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The patients mother had heart disease and the patients father had diabetes.

questions.question: In medical terms, what is a CVA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A stroke

questions.question: In medical parlance, what is an A-line?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arterial line

questions.question: Three of these snakes produce venom, lethal to humans.  Which one does not?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Desert Kingsnake

questions.question: After reading the following, what will a doctor conclude? Pt presents 3 d S/P TURP, with c/o HA x 2 d.

options.text: The patient recently had abdominal surgery.
The patient has no current complaints.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The patient has a headache.

questions.question: What part of the human body does the science periodontics study?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gums and mouth

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: People and Disorder
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, condition, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Located in the upper anterior portion of the chest cavity, the thymus is an organ belonging to which system of the human body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lymphatic System

questions.question: Ichthyology is the study of biting insects such a fleas, mosquitoes and wasps.
What scientists study recent or fossilized skeletal remains in order to find traces of ancient diseases?
Three of the following four disorders are actually different names for the same disease. Which is the odd one?
In humans, which of these organs belongs to the integumentary system?
People who suffer from this condition tend to be self-destructive. They may use drugs, or engage in promiscuous sexual activities.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Borderline Personality Disorder

questions.question: A person with this disorder has fluctuating levels of orientation.
People with this disorder have difficulty engaging in everyday human interaction.
People with this disorder engage in idiosyncratic behaviors, such as wearing an odd-looking hat every day, or wearing their pants backwards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Schizotypal Personality Disorder

questions.question: Which are the endocrine systems so-called instant messengers used to affect distant cells within specific organs?
People suffreing from this mental illness manifest a psychiatric condition as a physical complaint.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Somatization Disorder

questions.question: An old adage states, Neurotics build castles in the sand. Psychotics live in them.  Which one of the following disorders is not considered a neurosis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Schizoid Personality Disorder

questions.question: This disorder, also known as manic depression, involves high risk of death through suicide.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bipolar Disorder

questions.question: According to statistics, which of the following people is most likely to commit suicide?

options.text: A middle-aged divorced woman living alone.
A teenage boy who smokes marijuana.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A middle-aged divorced man.

questions.question: Depression can cause brain damage.
